result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Stephanie R. Barber was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
of Diane McNamer

Defendant Stephanie R. Barber in court with attorney James Jay Rennicke.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts. State files motion to amend count 1 to OWI 4th offense. DEF recieved copy of amended charge. Motion granted. DEF pled N/C to amended charge.  BAC: 0.278  Found guilty.  Very good report from Diane McNamer. Count 1:  330 days Home detention program with 3 days credit, , DL revoked for 33 months + 330 days with IID for 33 months commencing 8/7/15.  Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan, fine/forfeiture $ 2100.00.   Pay obligation within 10 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 10 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.        Count 2 & 3:    Dismiss and read-in     Report to STOP coordinator immediately.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-22-2015 02:30 pm

DEF in court with TW Duffy, still waiting on blood test results reset

SPECIAL BOND Conditions with DAILY Testing
  and working at LaCabana
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of: 
La Cabana for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to DAILY TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
